4125043967,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-scientist-at-kayak-4125043967?position=45&pageNum=0&refId=B%2BtWs8DKQtaLXhDjgf6faA%3D%3D&trackingId=1PFDLj4OnuLN44uiBbssfw%3D%3D,Senior Data Scientist,KAYAK,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!
Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices
Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models
Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year

Focus on mental health and well-being: Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth, Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace, Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Focus on your career growth: Development Dollars, Leadership development, Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings
Health insurance subsidy of 250 CHF per month
Lunch Check Card of 180 CHF per month
Profawo membership which is a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting the compatibility of family and work

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:


  • Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
  • Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
  • Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
  • Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
  • Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices


Please apply if you have:


  • Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
  • Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
  • Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
  • Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
  • Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
  • Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
  • Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
  • Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
  • Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models


Benefits:


  • Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
  • Focus on mental health and well-being: Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth, Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace, Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
  • No meeting Fridays
  • Paid parental leave
  • Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
  • Paid volunteer time
  • Focus on your career growth: Development Dollars, Leadership development, Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings
  • Travel Discounts
  • Employee Resource Groups
  • 5 weeks paid vacation
  • Social events &
column2:
Thursday happy hours
  • Free lunch 2 days per week
  • Pension plan contributions
  • Supplemental accident insurance
  • Health insurance subsidy of 250 CHF per month
  • Lunch Check Card of 180 CHF per month
  • Profawo membership which is a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting the compatibility of family and work


    • Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

    At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

    We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

4156887766,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-ml-engineer-z%C3%BCrich-at-lakera-4156887766?position=49&pageNum=0&refId=B%2BtWs8DKQtaLXhDjgf6faA%3D%3D&trackingId=hSswgr97TlPeBZKU2uIHdg%3D%3D,Senior ML Engineer (Zürich),Lakera,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","You want to operate at the cutting edge of AI, building the strongest defenses in the AI cybersecurity market. You will be increasing the scope and quality of our defenses, and playing a pivotal role in ensuring that GenAI applications can be deployed securely at scale. You will lead the creation of cutting-edge models that perform exceptionally well and operate in real time. This involves continuously identifying edge cases for our detectors and working to collect and generate intricate threat datasets to improve the performance of these models. You will ensure that Lakera can continuously ship the best defenses in the market with a high cadence. Your passion lies in shaping the future, working on ideas that define the secure use of AI in the decades ahead. Your work will play a vital role in ensuring that AI can unleash its best potential–for good.

Lakera is on a mission to ensure AI does what we want it to do. We are heading towards a future where AI agents run our businesses and personal lives. Here at Lakera, we're not just dreaming about the future
column2: we're building the security foundation for it. We empower security teams and builders so that their businesses can adopt AI technologies and unleash the next phase of intelligent computing.

column1: We work with Fortune 500 companies, startups, and foundation model providers to protect them and their users from adversarial misalignment. We are also the company behind Gandalf, the world’s most popular AI security game.
Lakera has offices in San Francisco and Zurich.

We move fast and work with intensity. We act as one team but expect everyone to take substantial ownership and accountability. We prioritize transparency at every level and are committed to always raising the bar in everything we do. We promote diversity of thought as we believe that creates the best outcomes.
Extend the scope of one of our detectors to support multiple languages without dropping performance on already supported languages.
Increase the scope where our defenses perform by 100x (e.g., multi-lingual data, code, etc).
Extend modeling and data generation to enable passing additional context to our prompt injection detectors, such as the LLM output and behavioral metadata.
Red team our model to understand the most pressing vulnerabilities of our detectors and prioritize the data collection and generation required to fix them.

You have at least 4 years of experience shipping machine learning models to production, ideally in environments where reliability and quality are key (e.g., autonomous driving, industrial applications, healthcare).
Most of your experience productionizing ML models has been in unstructured data spaces such as NLP and vision.
You have had experience working on end-to-end development of ML models.
You have experience working on the “long tail” of data distribution, bringing models from prototypes to real-world systems.
You aspire to play a pivotal role in defining the future of secure AI within a mission-driven company with ambitious goals.
👉 Let's stay connected! Follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter & Instagram to learn more about what is happening at Lakera.
ℹ️ Join us on Momentum, the slack community for AI Safety and Security everything.
❗To remove your information from our recruitment database, please email privacy@lakera.ai.

You want to operate at the cutting edge of AI, building the strongest defenses in the AI cybersecurity market. You will be increasing the scope and quality of our defenses, and playing a pivotal role in ensuring that GenAI applications can be deployed securely at scale. You will lead the creation of cutting-edge models that perform exceptionally well and operate in real time. This involves continuously identifying edge cases for our detectors and working to collect and generate intricate threat datasets to improve the performance of these models. You will ensure that Lakera can continuously ship the best defenses in the market with a high cadence. Your passion lies in shaping the future, working on ideas that define the secure use of AI in the decades ahead. Your work will play a vital role in ensuring that AI can unleash its best potential–for good.

About Lakera

Lakera is on a mission to ensure AI does what we want it to do. We are heading towards a future where AI agents run our businesses and personal lives. Here at Lakera, we're not just dreaming about the future
column2:
we're building the security foundation for it. We empower security teams and builders so that their businesses can adopt AI technologies and unleash the next phase of intelligent computing.

We work with Fortune 500 companies, startups, and foundation model providers to protect them and their users from adversarial misalignment. We are also the company behind Gandalf, the world’s most popular AI security game.

Lakera has offices in San Francisco and Zurich.

We move fast and work with intensity. We act as one team but expect everyone to take substantial ownership and accountability. We prioritize transparency at every level and are committed to always raising the bar in everything we do. We promote diversity of thought as we believe that creates the best outcomes.

Example projects

  • Extend the scope of one of our detectors to support multiple languages without dropping performance on already supported languages.
  • Increase the scope where our defenses perform by 100x (e.g., multi-lingual data, code, etc).
  • Extend modeling and data generation to enable passing additional context to our prompt injection detectors, such as the LLM output and behavioral metadata.
  • Red team our model to understand the most pressing vulnerabilities of our detectors and prioritize the data collection and generation required to fix them.

What You’ll Bring

  • You have at least 4 years of experience shipping machine learning models to production, ideally in environments where reliability and quality are key (e.g., autonomous driving, industrial applications, healthcare).
  • Most of your experience productionizing ML models has been in unstructured data spaces such as NLP and vision.
  • You have had experience working on end-to-end development of ML models.
  • You have experience working on the “long tail” of data distribution, bringing models from prototypes to real-world systems.
  • You aspire to play a pivotal role in defining the future of secure AI within a mission-driven company with ambitious goals.

👉 Let's stay connected! Follow us on LinkedIn, Twitter &
column3:
Instagram to learn more about what is happening at Lakera.

ℹ️ Join us on Momentum, the slack community for AI Safety and Security everything.

❗To remove your information from our recruitment database, please email privacy@lakera.ai.

4184922135,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/head-of-data-science-modeling-r-d-f-m-d-80-100%25-at-lonza-4184922135?position=50&pageNum=0&refId=B%2BtWs8DKQtaLXhDjgf6faA%3D%3D&trackingId=qhBcWS2qLu%2B3IVFwfA%2BnTA%3D%3D,Head of Data Science & Modeling R&D (f/m/d) 80-100%,Lonza,"Basel, Basel, Switzerland","Switzerland, Basel

Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across five continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

The role's purpose and scope are to Lead the SM data science and modeling strategy/ roadmap across the business platform to generate unique insights from data and develop new differentiated offerings using modeling tools. The incumbent will lead a team of expert data scientists/engineers, programmers and modeling experts (AI, mechanistic, statistical) deployed across multiple projects to enable the deployment of industry-leading data science and modeling capabilities.
An agile career and dynamic working culture in a growing environment.
Compensation programs that recognize high performance.
Act as strategic lead for data science and modeling across the organization (R&D, MSAT, dev services, etc) and partner with relevant leads in other Business platforms.
Effectively manage resources and projects in line with prioritized business needs.
Support all business areas (chemistry, bio enhancement, oral drug product, drug delivery), functions (R&D, operations, quality, etc) and sites.
Ensure advanced data science and modeling is a key enabler across our innovation pipeline and operations.
Partner with IT Hub and spoke with contacts to ensure aligned strategy and investment.
Ensure effective deployment of data ops/flows and visualization and modeling tools in operations, and services, through simplified workbenches, workflows, and apps as well as training.
Accelerate the adoption of AI/ML as well as statistical and mechanistic modeling in the organization including through partnerships / external collaborations.
Work closely with other SMEs (IT, Automation, analytical, etc) to ensure alignment of project and priorities.
PhD in Science, an equivalent professional qualification or occupational experience in Chemical engineering, statistics, chem-informatics/chemometrics .
Minimum of 10 years of experience leading/managing projects, including technology projects, in a pharmaceutical /CDMO setting .
Solid experience delivering strong value (new offerings, acceleration, etc) through the development and deployment of modeling tools in a pharmaceutical /CDMO environment.
Demonstrated ability to operate in a complex matrix environment.
Proven track record /scientific expertise in the development and deployment of complex modeling tools, programming, electronic lab notebooks, apps,etc
Established collaboration network and external recognition as SME in the field
Ability to operate at multiple levels from strategic planning to site operational deployment in line with broader R&D and BU objectives .
Support own and matrix team resource planning, project management activities and prioritization decisions.
Strong communication skills and capacity to translate technical information into business insights for decision-making process.

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

4187657215,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/researcher-scientist-cat-at-worldquant-4187657215?position=54&pageNum=0&refId=B%2BtWs8DKQtaLXhDjgf6faA%3D%3D&trackingId=UQp8aJHJywzj7Zn6W11CYA%3D%3D,Researcher/Scientist - Cat,WorldQuant,"Zug, Zug, Switzerland","WorldQuant develops and deploys systematic financial strategies across a broad range of asset classes and global markets. We seek to produce high-quality predictive signals (alphas) through our proprietary research platform to employ financial strategies focused on market inefficiencies. Our teams work collaboratively to drive the production of alphas and financial strategies – the foundation of a balanced, global investment platform.

WorldQuant is built on a culture that pairs academic sensibility with accountability for results. Employees are encouraged to think openly about problems, balancing intellectualism and practicality. Excellent ideas come from anyone, anywhere. Employees are encouraged to challenge conventional thinking and possess an attitude of continuous improvement.

Our goal is to hire the best and the brightest. We value intellectual horsepower first and foremost, and people who demonstrate an outstanding talent. There is no roadmap to future success, so we need people who can help us build it.
The Role: We are seeking an exceptionally talented Researcher/Scientist to join our team.

In the role, you will work on critical aspects of WorldQuant’s research, modeling, and infrastructure, including risk models, market impact models, trade optimization, and the firm’s central hedging facility.
Knowledge of Python (including NumPy) and Linux/Unix platforms
column2: familiarity with scripting languages

column1: Code optimization experience is a plus
Possesses hybrid skillset with strong quantitative and coding abilities.
Exceptional communication skills in both verbal and written form
Mature and thoughtful, with the ability to operate in a collaborative, team-oriented culture
Motivated by the transformational effects of technology-at-scale
Experience in finance is a plus but not required

WorldQuant develops and deploys systematic financial strategies across a broad range of asset classes and global markets. We seek to produce high-quality predictive signals (alphas) through our proprietary research platform to employ financial strategies focused on market inefficiencies. Our teams work collaboratively to drive the production of alphas and financial strategies – the foundation of a balanced, global investment platform.

WorldQuant is built on a culture that pairs academic sensibility with accountability for results. Employees are encouraged to think openly about problems, balancing intellectualism and practicality. Excellent ideas come from anyone, anywhere. Employees are encouraged to challenge conventional thinking and possess an attitude of continuous improvement.

Our goal is to hire the best and the brightest. We value intellectual horsepower first and foremost, and people who demonstrate an outstanding talent. There is no roadmap to future success, so we need people who can help us build it.

The Role: We are seeking an exceptionally talented Researcher/Scientist to join our team.

In the role, you will work on critical aspects of WorldQuant’s research, modeling, and infrastructure, including risk models, market impact models, trade optimization, and the firm’s central hedging facility.

What You’ll Bring

  • 5 years of hands-on experience
  • Knowledge of Python (including NumPy) and Linux/Unix platforms

4182790118,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/research-engineer-data-foundational-research-machine-learning-at-thomson-reuters-4182790118?position=55&pageNum=0&refId=B%2BtWs8DKQtaLXhDjgf6faA%3D%3D&trackingId=IslmSX5hmcRPvfdbCadvJQ%3D%3D,"Research Engineer, Data (Foundational Research, Machine Learning)",Thomson Reuters,"Zug, Zug, Switzerland","Are you a curious and open-minded individual with an interest in state-of-the-art machine learning engineering and research? Thomson Reuters Labs is seeking a Data Engineer with a passion for solving challenging machine learning problems in a data-rich, complex and innovative environment.

What does Thomson Reuters Labs do? We experiment, we build, we deliver. We support the organization and our product teams through foundational research and development of new products and technologies. The Labs innovate collaboratively across our core segments in Legal, Tax & Accounting, Government, and Reuters News. We undertake a diverse portfolio of projects while investing in long-term research for the future.

As a Research Engineer, you will be part of a diverse global team of experts. We hire worldleading specialists in SWE /Applied ML, as well as Research, to drive the company’s leading internal AI model development, fueled by an unprecedented wealth of data and powered by cutting-edge technical infrastructure. You will have the opportunity to contribute to a data curation & filtering system combining the best of real-world scalable data processing systems combined with the latest insights into what training data leads to the best LLMs. Thomson Reuters Labs is known for consistently delivering successful datadriven Artificial Intelligence solutions in support of high-growth products that serve Thomson Reuters customers in new and exciting ways.
In this opportunity as a Research Engineer - Data, you will:

Innovate: You will work at the very cutting edge of AI Research at an institution with some of the richest data sources in the world. Through your work, you will help us make the best use of this resource, in a dynamic flywheel that connects data collection & annotation with model training and expert evaluation, helping us continuously improve our training data. You will also develop novel performance-driven data sub-selection methods together with the latest training insights from our researchers.

Engineer and Develop: Design, develop, and optimize scalable data pipelines to support LLM training and evaluation. You will also help us develop this in a robust and testable way, through careful source control and a solid back-up system for various data versioning methods.

Collaborate: Working on a collaborative global team of engineers and scientists both within Thomson Reuters and our academic partners at world-leading universities. In addition, you will work closely with world experts in the legal domain, which can provide feedback to your work and/or evaluate your outputs or annotate training data.
You're a fit for the role of Research Engineer - Data, if your background includes:
Relevant degree in a technical discipline.
Interest in & experience working with (applied) machine learning, e.g. few-shot learning with out-of-the-box language models, training of smaller NLP classifiers, etc.
Excellent programming, debugging and system design skills.
Excellent communication skills to report and present software designs and findings clearly, both orally and in writing.
Curious and innovative disposition capable of devising novel, well-founded algorithmic solutions to relevant problems.
Self-driven attitude and ability to work with limited supervision.
Experience with relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, Cassandra).
Experience with data pipeline orchestration tools.
Experience with cloud-based data platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure (e.g., S3, BigQuery, Azure Data Lake Storage).
Comfortable working in fast-paced, agile environments, managing uncertainty and ambiguity.
Additional legal knowledge as evidenced by a degree or interest in the legal domain.
Ability to communicate with multiple stakeholders, including non-technical legal subject matter experts.
Experience with big data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, or similar.
Experience conducting world-leading research, e.g. by contributions to publications at leading ML venues.
Previous experience working on large-scale data processing systems.
Strong software and/or infrastructure engineering skills, as evidenced by code contributions to popular open-source libraries.

Join us to inform the way forward with the latest AI solutions and address real-world challenges in legal, tax, compliance, and news. Backed by our commitment to continuous learning and market-leading benefits, you’ll be prepared to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future. This includes:

Industry-Leading Benefits: We offer comprehensive benefit plans to include flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days off, access to the Headspace app, retirement savings, tuition reimbursement, employee incentive programs, and resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.

Flexibility & Work-Life Balance: Flex My Way is a set of supportive workplace policies designed to help manage personal and professional responsibilities, whether caring for family, giving back to the community, or finding time to refresh and reset. This builds upon our flexible work arrangements, including work from anywhere for up to 8 weeks per year, and hybrid model, empowering employees to achieve a better work-life balance.

Career Development and Growth: By fostering a culture of continuous learning and skill development, we prepare our talent to tackle tomorrow’s challenges and deliver real-world solutions. Our skills-first approach ensures you have the tools and knowledge to grow, lead, and thrive in an AI-enabled future.

Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for inclusion, innovation, and customer-focus. Our eleven business resource groups nurture our culture of belonging across the diverse backgrounds and experiences represented across our global footprint.

Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connected.

Social Impact: Make an impact in your community with our Social Impact Institute. We offer employees two paid volunteer days off annually and opportunities to get involved with pro-bono consulting projects and Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) initiatives.

The above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.
We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

4195887048,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/global-sr-data-scientist-at-nestl%C3%A9-health-science-4195887048?position=59&pageNum=0&refId=B%2BtWs8DKQtaLXhDjgf6faA%3D%3D&trackingId=c%2FY6CDxV6YKCfzUAJCKRwQ%3D%3D,Global Sr Data Scientist,Nestlé Health Science,"Lausanne, Vaud, Switzerland","Nestlé Health Science is a globally recognized leader in the science of nutrition, with more than 11,000 employees around the world. With a portfolio of science-based consumer health, medical nutrition, vitamin and supplement brands, and pharmaceutical therapies, we are redefining the management of health.
Location: Flexible (FR, DE, Switzerland and Spain)
Exciting opportunities to develop your career your way
column2: across different brands, businesses, functions, and regions.

column1: Flexible working arrangements - facilitating creativity and collaboration
A culture of respect, with diversity, equity and inclusion at its core. Learn more here.
A dynamic international environment empowering you to learn, develop and grow.
Don’t hesitate to connect with us during the recruitment process to learn more.

The NHSc Global Senior Data Scientist will design, develop, and deploy statistical and algorithmic solutions to address complex business challenges. You will analyze large, diverse data sets, formulate testing strategies, and validate hypotheses to deliver actionable insights. Collaborating with Data Engineers, you will industrialize scalable solutions and demonstrate expertise in data preparation, statistical modeling, report writing, and insight generation.
A day in the life of a NHSc Global Senior Data Scientist
Determine data requirements for training and developing models.
Prepare data, variables, models, tests, and validate hypotheses to answer business questions.
Prove or invalidate hypotheses to address business questions.
Coach and mentor junior data scientists or analysts (internal or external).
Work with stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
Identify opportunities to optimize investments and deployments in data across markets.
Coordinate projects and present initiatives to all stakeholders, recommending best practices.
Master's Degree or PhD in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Machine Learning).
Experience: 5+ years of hands-on experience in data science within applied analytics.
Proficiency in advanced machine learning algorithms and statistical techniques.
Proven track record of solving complex business problems using statistics and machine learning.
Exceptional communication skills for engaging both technical and non-technical audiences.
Strong problem-solving abilities and a product-oriented mindset.
Proven ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders across various teams and organizational levels.
Deep understanding of E-commerce domains, with sales expertise being a plus.
Industry expertise in FMCG is needed, experience in consumer health/pharma is a plus.
Proven ability to mentor, coach, and develop junior data scientists and analysts.

Nestlé is committed to the accessibility of its recruitment process. If you require an adaptation during the recruitment process, please do let us know so we can support you effectively. All information will be treated confidentially.

Nestlé Health Science is a leader in the science of nutrition, offering an extensive portfolio of science-based consumer health, medical nutrition, pharmaceutical therapies, and vitamin and supplement brands.  Headquartered in Switzerland, we have more than 11,000 employees around the world, with products available in more than 140 countries.

Nutrition can be life-transforming for those who need extra support during short- or long-term medical challenges, and it can enhance the quality of life of those who are already healthy.  With an extensive research network providing the foundation for products that can help people to live their healthiest lives, our commitment to science-based products means that we provide nutritional solutions that can make a real difference in the quality of life of customers, patients, and caregivers.
Find out more about Nestlé Health Science at Nestlehealthscience.com.

At Nestlé, we want to help shape a better and healthier world, inspire people to live healthier lives and deliver impact at a scale and pace that makes a difference. We do this by fostering a diverse, friendly, supportive, and collaborative environment, that creates positive disruption, embraces innovation, and empowers people and teams to win. We aim to hire friendly, respectful, inspiring people who care about the people’s lives that we touch every single day.
Be a force for good. Join Nestlé and visit us on www.nestle.com.

Nestlé Health Science is a globally recognized leader in the science of nutrition, with more than 11,000 employees around the world. With a portfolio of science-based consumer health, medical nutrition, vitamin and supplement brands, and pharmaceutical therapies, we are redefining the management of health.

Position Snapshot

Location: Flexible (FR, DE, Switzerland and Spain)

Company: Nestlé Health Science

Act. Rate: Full-Time Act. Rate 100%

Type of contract: Permanent contract

What We Offer At Nestlé

Exciting opportunities to develop your career your way
column2:
across different brands, businesses, functions, and regions.

Flexible working arrangements - facilitating creativity and collaboration

A culture of respect, with diversity, equity and inclusion at its core. Learn more here.

A dynamic international environment empowering you to learn, develop and grow.

Don’t hesitate to connect with us during the recruitment process to learn more.

Position Summary

The NHSc Global Senior Data Scientist will design, develop, and deploy statistical and algorithmic solutions to address complex business challenges. You will analyze large, diverse data sets, formulate testing strategies, and validate hypotheses to deliver actionable insights. Collaborating with Data Engineers, you will industrialize scalable solutions and demonstrate expertise in data preparation, statistical modeling, report writing, and insight generation.

A day in the life of a NHSc Global Senior Data Scientist

  • Develop and execute product/project roadmap.
  • Determine data requirements for training and developing models.
  • Prepare data, variables, models, tests, and validate hypotheses to answer business questions.
  • Prove or invalidate hypotheses to address business questions.
  • Coach and mentor junior data scientists or analysts (internal or external).
  • Work with stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
  • Identify opportunities to optimize investments and deployments in data across markets.
  • Coordinate projects and present initiatives to all stakeholders, recommending best practices.

What Will Make You Successful

  • Master's Degree or PhD in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Machine Learning).
  • Experience: 5+ years of hands-on experience in data science within applied analytics.
  • Proficiency in advanced machine learning algorithms and statistical techniques.
  • Proven track record of solving complex business problems using statistics and machine learning.
  • Exceptional communication skills for engaging both technical and non-technical audiences.
  • Strong problem-solving abilities and a product-oriented mindset.
  • Proven ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders across various teams and organizational levels.
  • Deep understanding of E-commerce domains, with sales expertise being a plus.
  • Industry expertise in FMCG is needed, experience in consumer health/pharma is a plus.
  • Proven ability to mentor, coach, and develop junior data scientists and analysts.

Nestlé is committed to the accessibility of its recruitment process. If you require an adaptation during the recruitment process, please do let us know so we can support you effectively. All information will be treated confidentially.

Nestlé Health Science is a leader in the science of nutrition, offering an extensive portfolio of science-based consumer health, medical nutrition, pharmaceutical therapies, and vitamin and supplement brands.  Headquartered in Switzerland, we have more than 11,000 employees around the world, with products available in more than 140 countries.  

Nutrition can be life-transforming for those who need extra support during short- or long-term medical challenges, and it can enhance the quality of life of those who are already healthy.  With an extensive research network providing the foundation for products that can help people to live their healthiest lives, our commitment to science-based products means that we provide nutritional solutions that can make a real difference in the quality of life of customers, patients, and caregivers.   

Find out more about Nestlé Health Science at Nestlehealthscience.com.

At Nestlé, we want to help shape a better and healthier world, inspire people to live healthier lives and deliver impact at a scale and pace that makes a difference. We do this by fostering a diverse, friendly, supportive, and collaborative environment, that creates positive disruption, embraces innovation, and empowers people and teams to win. We aim to hire friendly, respectful, inspiring people who care about the people’s lives that we touch every single day.

Be a force for good. Join Nestlé and visit us on www.nestle.com.

4197071184,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ml-data-science-specialist-at-brack-alltron-4197071184?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=41E01ZA6u6P7SLH%2B%2Fh0g%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=ov2LS1jFR8o3V87o9Pk%2BSQ%3D%3D,ML / Data Science Specialist,Brack.Alltron,"Mägenwil, Aargau, Switzerland","Bist du ein visionärer ML / Data Sciene Specialist, der mit datengestützten Erkenntnissen und innovativen maschinellen Lernmodellen einen spürbaren Beitrag leisten möchte? Zeichnest du durch die Umwandlung von Daten in umsetzbare Strategien aus, die den Geschäftserfolg fördern? Dann wollen wir dich als ML / Data Science Specialist in unserem Team haben! Als ML / Data Science Specialist wirst du eine Schlüsselrolle bei der Revolutionierung unserer Datenstrategie und der Verbesserung unserer Geschäftsprozesse spielen.

Einblicksgesteuerte Optimierung: Nutze datengestützte Erkenntnisse, um das Kundenerlebnis zu verbessern, die dynamische Preisgestaltung zu optimieren und die Logistik oder Produktempfehlungen zu verbessern.
Kompetenz im maschinellen Lernen: Entwickle und trainiere moderne maschinelle Lernmodelle für Personalisierung, Empfehlungen und prädiktive Analysen.
Prototyping und Validierung: Erstelle Prototypen, verfeinere Modelle mit einzigartigen Daten und validieren die Leistung, um die besten Basismodelle oder erweiterten ML-Algorithmen auszuwählen.
Robuster Bewertungsrahmen: Erstelle einen umfassenden Bewertungsrahmen, um die Leistung der Modelle kontinuierlich zu verbessern.
Strategien für Benutzer-Feedback: Definiere Strategien zur Sammlung von Nutzerfeedback für die Modellabstimmung und -verbesserung.
Datenuntersuchung: Analysiere grosse Datensätze, um Trends, Muster und verwertbare Erkenntnisse zu erkennen.
Cloud-basierte Modellierung: Erstelle Modelle mit ML-Tools in der Cloud, vorzugsweise auf der Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Skalierbare ML-Plattform: Arbeite mit dem DevOps-Team zusammen, um eine skalierbare ML-Plattform mit einem Modellgarten und der Möglichkeit zum nahtlosen Experimentieren und Testen zu erstellen.
Erstellung von Datenprodukten: Nutzung von Daten aus verschiedenen Teams und Erstellung neuer Datenprodukte, die über einen Datenkatalog im Unternehmen veröffentlicht werden.
Produktionsbereitstellung: Einsatz von ML-Modellen in der Produktion, Optimierung für Skalierbarkeit.
Erkennung von Anomalien: Überwachen der Modellinferenz, Erstellen von Dashboards und Warnsystemen, um die Beteiligten über Anomalien zu informieren.
Kontinuierliche Verbesserung: Regelmässiges Überwachen, Analysieren und Optimieren der Leistung, Sicherheit und Zuverlässigkeit unserer ML-Infrastruktur.
Integrität und Sicherheit: Sicherstellung der Datenintegrität und -sicherheit durch klare Governance-Richtlinien.
Kollaborative Verbesserung: Arbeite mit Geschäftsteams, z. B. dem Marketing, zusammen, um Prozesse mit ML-Modellen und datengesteuerten Strategien zu verbessern.
Automatisierte Entscheidungsfindung: Automatisiere Entscheidungsprozesse innerhalb von IT-Systemen mit Hilfe von ML-Modellen.
Informiert bleiben: Bleibe auf dem Laufenden über die neuesten Fortschritte in den Bereichen Datenwissenschaft, KI und E-Commerce-Trends.
Kontinuierliches Lernen: Bilde dich durch Online-Kurse und Selbststudium weiter.

Vertrauensvolle Partnerschaften: Arbeite eng mit Führungskräften aus den Bereichen Engineering Online Shops, Business Applications und BI zusammen, um technische und geschäftliche Ziele aufeinander abzustimmen.
Effektive Kommunikation: Kommuniziere effektiv auf allen Ebenen und setze dich mit Klarheit und Überzeugung für AI-first-Initiativen ein.
Ein Bachelor- oder Master-Abschluss in Data Science, Informatik, Statistik oder einem verwandten Fachgebiet oder gleichwertige Erfahrung.
Mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in Data Science und maschinellem Lernen, vorzugsweise im E-Commerce, Einzelhandel oder digitalen Marketing.
Nachgewiesene Erfahrung in der Erstellung und dem Einsatz von ML-Modellen in der Produktion.
Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python/R und SQL.
Erfahrung mit ML- und AI-Produkten von Google Cloud Platform, AWS oder Azure (Erfahrung mit Google Vertex AI ist ein Plus).
Praktische Erfahrung mit Frameworks für maschinelles Lernen wie Scikit-learn, TensorFlow und PyTorch.
Kenntnisse in MLOps und der Bereitstellung von Modellen in grossem Massstab sind von Vorteil.
Starke Storytelling-Fähigkeiten zur Präsentation von Erkenntnissen für nicht-technische Interessengruppen.
Aktives Engagement in der ML- resp. Data-Science-Community.
Erfahrung in agilen Umgebungen, unter Verwendung von Methoden wie Scrum oder Kanban.
Leidenschaft für technologische Innovation und kontinuierliche Verbesserung.
Beherrschung der deutschen und englischen Sprache für eine effektive Kommunikation.
Bist du interessiert oder hast du weiterführende Fragen?
Sercan Ugur steht dir gerne telefonisch oder elektronisch zur Verfügung.

Bist du ein visionärer ML / Data Sciene Specialist, der mit datengestützten Erkenntnissen und innovativen maschinellen Lernmodellen einen spürbaren Beitrag leisten möchte? Zeichnest du durch die Umwandlung von Daten in umsetzbare Strategien aus, die den Geschäftserfolg fördern? Dann wollen wir dich als ML / Data Science Specialist in unserem Team haben! Als ML / Data Science Specialist wirst du eine Schlüsselrolle bei der Revolutionierung unserer Datenstrategie und der Verbesserung unserer Geschäftsprozesse spielen.

Das erwartet dich

  • Deine Verantwortlichkeiten
  • Einblicksgesteuerte Optimierung: Nutze datengestützte Erkenntnisse, um das Kundenerlebnis zu verbessern, die dynamische Preisgestaltung zu optimieren und die Logistik oder Produktempfehlungen zu verbessern.
  • Kompetenz im maschinellen Lernen: Entwickle und trainiere moderne maschinelle Lernmodelle für Personalisierung, Empfehlungen und prädiktive Analysen.
  • Prototyping und Validierung: Erstelle Prototypen, verfeinere Modelle mit einzigartigen Daten und validieren die Leistung, um die besten Basismodelle oder erweiterten ML-Algorithmen auszuwählen.
  • Robuster Bewertungsrahmen: Erstelle einen umfassenden Bewertungsrahmen, um die Leistung der Modelle kontinuierlich zu verbessern.
  • Strategien für Benutzer-Feedback: Definiere Strategien zur Sammlung von Nutzerfeedback für die Modellabstimmung und -verbesserung.
  • Datenuntersuchung: Analysiere grosse Datensätze, um Trends, Muster und verwertbare Erkenntnisse zu erkennen.
  • Cloud-basierte Modellierung: Erstelle Modelle mit ML-Tools in der Cloud, vorzugsweise auf der Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
  • ML-Infrastruktur und -Architektur:
  • Skalierbare ML-Plattform: Arbeite mit dem DevOps-Team zusammen, um eine skalierbare ML-Plattform mit einem Modellgarten und der Möglichkeit zum nahtlosen Experimentieren und Testen zu erstellen.
  • Erstellung von Datenprodukten: Nutzung von Daten aus verschiedenen Teams und Erstellung neuer Datenprodukte, die über einen Datenkatalog im Unternehmen veröffentlicht werden.
  • Betrieb und Optimierung:
  • Produktionsbereitstellung: Einsatz von ML-Modellen in der Produktion, Optimierung für Skalierbarkeit.
  • Erkennung von Anomalien: Überwachen der Modellinferenz, Erstellen von Dashboards und Warnsystemen, um die Beteiligten über Anomalien zu informieren.
  • Kontinuierliche Verbesserung: Regelmässiges Überwachen, Analysieren und Optimieren der Leistung, Sicherheit und Zuverlässigkeit unserer ML-Infrastruktur.
  • Datenverwaltung und -qualität:
  • Integrität und Sicherheit: Sicherstellung der Datenintegrität und -sicherheit durch klare Governance-Richtlinien.
  • Datengestützte Entscheidungsfindung:
  • Kollaborative Verbesserung: Arbeite mit Geschäftsteams, z. B. dem Marketing, zusammen, um Prozesse mit ML-Modellen und datengesteuerten Strategien zu verbessern.
  • Automatisierte Entscheidungsfindung: Automatisiere Entscheidungsprozesse innerhalb von IT-Systemen mit Hilfe von ML-Modellen.
  • Innovation und Technologieforschung:
  • Informiert bleiben: Bleibe auf dem Laufenden über die neuesten Fortschritte in den Bereichen Datenwissenschaft, KI und E-Commerce-Trends.
  • Kontinuierliches Lernen: Bilde dich durch Online-Kurse und Selbststudium weiter.
  • Stakeholder-Management &
column2:
Zusammenarbeit:
  • Vertrauensvolle Partnerschaften: Arbeite eng mit Führungskräften aus den Bereichen Engineering Online Shops, Business Applications und BI zusammen, um technische und geschäftliche Ziele aufeinander abzustimmen.
  • Effektive Kommunikation: Kommuniziere effektiv auf allen Ebenen und setze dich mit Klarheit und Überzeugung für AI-first-Initiativen ein.

    • Das bringst du mit

    • Ein Bachelor- oder Master-Abschluss in Data Science, Informatik, Statistik oder einem verwandten Fachgebiet oder gleichwertige Erfahrung.
    • Mindestens 3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in Data Science und maschinellem Lernen, vorzugsweise im E-Commerce, Einzelhandel oder digitalen Marketing.
    • Nachgewiesene Erfahrung in der Erstellung und dem Einsatz von ML-Modellen in der Produktion.
    • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in Python/R und SQL.
    • Erfahrung mit ML- und AI-Produkten von Google Cloud Platform, AWS oder Azure (Erfahrung mit Google Vertex AI ist ein Plus).
    • Praktische Erfahrung mit Frameworks für maschinelles Lernen wie Scikit-learn, TensorFlow und PyTorch.
    • Kenntnisse in MLOps und der Bereitstellung von Modellen in grossem Massstab sind von Vorteil.
    • Starke Storytelling-Fähigkeiten zur Präsentation von Erkenntnissen für nicht-technische Interessengruppen.
    • Aktives Engagement in der ML- resp. Data-Science-Community.
    • Erfahrung in agilen Umgebungen, unter Verwendung von Methoden wie Scrum oder Kanban.
    • Leidenschaft für technologische Innovation und kontinuierliche Verbesserung.
    • Beherrschung der deutschen und englischen Sprache für eine effektive Kommunikation.

    Bist du interessiert oder hast du weiterführende Fragen?

    Sercan Ugur steht dir gerne telefonisch oder elektronisch zur Verfügung.

    sercan.ugur@brackalltron.ch

4199164061,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-machine-learning-engineer-at-reor20-4199164061?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=41E01ZA6u6P7SLH%2B%2Fh0g%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=jXq%2FqW0WPEmif1Nxaok5vg%3D%3D,Senior Machine Learning Engineer,REOR20,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland"," Competitive package: Salary, Options (we want you to take ownership) & awesome benefits (in fact, you will be part of defining the benefit package!)

Floods are making headlines daily, posing a growing threat worldwide. Ready to join a fast-paced company at the forefront of flood intelligence? REOR20 is looking for dynamic individuals to be key players in our mission to help communities and decision makers manage flood risks in the era of climate change.
AI is the buzzword, but we’re taking it to the next level with physics-based AI. We’re gearing up to revolutionize the industry with our cutting-edge technology.
Join us and be part of the storm that shields against flood disasters!
REOR20 is not just another flood modeling company
column2: we are a deep tech firm developing technology that, until recently, seemed like science fiction. Our innovative approach offers unparalleled flood risk understanding, pushing the boundaries of what is possible.

column1: We are pioneering the next generation of technology to deliver precise, timely flood hazard intelligence – something the industry has never seen before. Our groundbreaking approach merges high-fidelity computational engineering tools with innovative AI methodologies.
Our products are the essential tools needed to win the battle against global flooding and the climate crisis.

Our vision is clear: to become the global leader in flood hazard intelligence, setting the standard that others strive to meet. We are assembling our core engineering team to build and launch the first commercial-scale version of our product. Joining this team means engaging in a variety of tasks and taking on diverse responsibilities.
REOR20 champions an open, flexible, and inclusive culture. We pursue excellence, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and embrace the diverse challenges across all aspects of our company.

We offer excitement, fun, and a rewarding mission! Join us, and you’ll always be at the forefront, contributing to a future where our solutions save lives, protect properties, and create a safer, more resilient world.

Join our innovative and dynamic startup as a Machine Learning Engineer and play a pivotal role in the development of our groundbreaking flood prediction technology. You will lead and own the end-to-end design, implementation, and deployment of advanced deep learning models. Leveraging your expertise in Machine Learning and Software Engineering, you will create and extend robust and scalable pipelines that drive our data processing, model training, and deployment infrastructure. Your work will ensure the optimal performance and reliability of our cutting-edge flood prediction systems, helping to mitigate the impact of floods worldwide.
Design, develop, and implement state-of-the-art solutions along the entire model development life cycle, focusing on optimizing performance and scalability.
Build and maintain the infrastructure for training and testing machine learning models, create and manage large datasets, and ensure robust and scalable data pipelines.
Investigate and propose new tools and infrastructure to accelerate the development of our state-of-the-art flood models and to optimize all key steps of the model pipeline
Collaborate with software engineers to deliver deployment ready models.
You should apply if you have
Excellent coding skills with proficiency in Python and hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks (preferably PyTorch).
Affinity for designing and optimize machine learning pipelines for scalability and performance
Experience in large-scale data processing and cloud computing (e.g., AWS) is preferred
Knowledge of MLOps best practices or large-scale model deployment is a plus

column2: Competitive package: Salary, Options (we want you to take ownership) &
column3: awesome benefits (in fact, you will be part of defining the benefit package!)

4202461702,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/internship-r-d-engineer-data-science-at-sulzer-services-4202461702?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=41E01ZA6u6P7SLH%2B%2Fh0g%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=%2Fd6FFbUCgh041XPznuZuWQ%3D%3D,Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science),Sulzer Services,"Oberwinterthur, Zurich, Switzerland","CT_Technology & Innovation-E122
Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science) - Full Time - Oberwinterthur, Switzerland

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.
We are looking for an R&D Engineer, Data Science Intern to join our Chemtech, Technology and Innovation, team in Oberwinterthur.

Join our R&D team for six months and develop innovative solutions for the chemical industry and sustainable technologies, including carbon capture and emission control. Focused on digitalization, you will help drive data-driven product development from ideation to market-ready solutions within our Separation Technology business unit.
Collaborate in Contribute to data-driven product development within the Separation Technology business unit.
Collect, organize, and analyze experimental data from our pilot plants and production facilities.
Identify opportunities to enhance our experimental design and critical parameters for product optimization.
Play an active role in implementing new analytical technologies to support digital transformation.
To Succeed In This Role, You Will Need
Student or recent graduate in Chemical, Process, or Mechanical Engineering (related disciplines welcome).
Experience in data evaluation, modeling, visualization, and data-driven analysis.
Previous experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office is expected.
Curious, motivated team player with a knack for problem-solving and a desire to advance your career in a dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment.
Access to a wide range of discounts
No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role.
Do you have a question about the role?
Reach out to Alexi Donadoni at Alexi.Donadoni@sulzer.com . Our team is looking forward hearing from you!
Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.
We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2025 in Brazil, China, Finland, Germany, Ireland, Switzerland, South Africa, the UK and the USA.

PXL Vision is the Swiss market leader and premium provider of identity verification for companies. Based on artificial intelligence, PXL Vision offers a highly flexible, modular and configurable software platform for secure and fully automated identity verification to meet complex requirements worldwide.
We aim to develop innovative, secure and reliable identity verification solutions, always with our customers in mind.
The company is headquartered in Zurich, Switzerland, and operates throughout Europe.

Your mission

4191452674,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-ai-engineer-at-mesoneer-4191452674?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=41E01ZA6u6P7SLH%2B%2Fh0g%2BQ%3D%3D&trackingId=dxZh25tiqwzTC%2BGToGRbFA%3D%3D,Senior AI Engineer,mesoneer,"Wallisellen / Hof, Zurich, Switzerland","mesoneer ist eine der führenden Schweizer Softwareschmieden in den Bereichen Digital Onboarding, Prozessautomatisierung sowie Integration komplexer Umsysteme. Unsere rund 120 Mitarbeitenden in der Schweiz und Vietnam digitalisieren und vereinfachen Businessprozesse mit individuellen Softwarelösungen, modernisieren veraltete Anwendungen und entwickeln hauseigene SaaS-Lösungen. Für unsere Kunden aus der Finanz- und Versicherungsbranche, der öffentlichen Verwaltung oder der Industrie brauchen wir dich!
Analyse von Kundenanforderungen und Konzeption von Lösungsarchitekturen auf Basis modernster AI-Technologien.
Entwicklung und Implementierung von AI-Modellen (z.B. mittels RAG und AI Agents) zur Bearbeitung komplexer Geschäftsanforderungen.
Integration und Optimierung von AI-Lösungen in bestehende Software- und Cloud-Umgebungen.
Kontinuierliche Evaluation neuer AI-Technologien hinsichtlich Praxistauglichkeit und Mehrwert.
Sicherstellung von Skalierbarkeit, Sicherheit und Performance der entwickelten AI-Anwendungen.
Durchführung von AI-Workshops beim Kunden und eigenverantwortliche Leitung von AI-Projekten, vom Konzept bis zur Umsetzung
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Mathematik, Data Science oder einer verwandten Fachrichtungen.
Mehrjährige Praxiserfahrung in der Entwicklung und dem operativen Einsatz von AI- und Machine-Learning-Lösungen.
Tiefgehende Kenntnisse in Python, sowie fundierte praktische Erfahrung mit TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain oder vergleichbaren Frameworks.
Erfahrung im Einsatz von Cloud-Plattformen (insbesondere Microsoft Azure Cloud) sowie Integration und Anwendung von OpenAI-Technologien.
Praxis in der Nutzung und lokalen Implementierung von Open-Source-LLMs.
Vertrautheit mit modernen Datenplattformen und -technologien wie Azure Fabric, Snowflake und Kafka.
Fliessend Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift.
Warum wirst du die Arbeit bei mesoneer lieben?
Flexible, moderne Arbeitszeitmodelle & Work from Home

Unser hoch motiviertes und unterstützendes Team lebt eine offene Fehlerkultur und pflegt intensiven Wissensaustausch. Bei uns bist du nicht nur eine Nummer, sondern kannst dich tatsächlich mit deinen Ideen einbringen, an sinnvollen Projekten arbeiten und Dinge weiterentwickeln. Damit die Work-Life-Balance stimmt, ist unser Standort in Wallisellen bei Zürich nicht nur perfekt mit den ÖV erreichbar, bei uns profitierst du auch von einem Jahresarbeitszeitmodell, zusätzlichem Vaterschaftsurlaub und der Möglichkeit auf unbezahlten Zusatzurlaub. Wir fördern ausserdem Sport-Abos und Weiterbildung.
Es werden nur Direktbewerbungen akzeptiert – keine Personalvermittlungen oder Headhunter.

mesoneer ist eine der führenden Schweizer Softwareschmieden in den Bereichen Digital Onboarding, Prozessautomatisierung sowie Integration komplexer Umsysteme. Unsere rund 120 Mitarbeitenden in der Schweiz und Vietnam digitalisieren und vereinfachen Businessprozesse mit individuellen Softwarelösungen, modernisieren veraltete Anwendungen und entwickeln hauseigene SaaS-Lösungen. Für unsere Kunden aus der Finanz- und Versicherungsbranche, der öffentlichen Verwaltung oder der Industrie brauchen wir dich!


Was dich erwartet

  • Analyse von Kundenanforderungen und Konzeption von Lösungsarchitekturen auf Basis modernster AI-Technologien.
  • Entwicklung und Implementierung von AI-Modellen (z.B. mittels RAG und AI Agents) zur Bearbeitung komplexer Geschäftsanforderungen.
  • Integration und Optimierung von AI-Lösungen in bestehende Software- und Cloud-Umgebungen.
  • Kontinuierliche Evaluation neuer AI-Technologien hinsichtlich Praxistauglichkeit und Mehrwert.
  • Sicherstellung von Skalierbarkeit, Sicherheit und Performance der entwickelten AI-Anwendungen.
  • Durchführung von AI-Workshops beim Kunden und eigenverantwortliche Leitung von AI-Projekten, vom Konzept bis zur Umsetzung


Was du mitbringst

  • Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Mathematik, Data Science oder einer verwandten Fachrichtungen.
  • Mehrjährige Praxiserfahrung in der Entwicklung und dem operativen Einsatz von AI- und Machine-Learning-Lösungen.
  • Tiefgehende Kenntnisse in Python, sowie fundierte praktische Erfahrung mit TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain oder vergleichbaren Frameworks.
  • Erfahrung im Einsatz von Cloud-Plattformen (insbesondere Microsoft Azure Cloud) sowie Integration und Anwendung von OpenAI-Technologien.
  • Praxis in der Nutzung und lokalen Implementierung von Open-Source-LLMs.
  • Vertrautheit mit modernen Datenplattformen und -technologien wie Azure Fabric, Snowflake und Kafka.
  • Strukturierte, eigenständige und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise.
  • Starke Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und ausgeprägte Teamorientierung.
  • Fliessend Deutsch und Englisch in Wort und Schrift.


Warum wirst du die Arbeit bei mesoneer lieben?

  • Flexible, moderne Arbeitszeitmodelle &
column2:
Work from Home
  • Frei an deinem Geburtstag (zusätzlicher Urlaubstag)
  • Selbständiges Arbeiten und flache Hierarchien
  • Modernste Arbeitsmittel und Methoden
  • Teamevents &
column3:
Fun


Unser hoch motiviertes und unterstützendes Team lebt eine offene Fehlerkultur und pflegt intensiven Wissensaustausch. Bei uns bist du nicht nur eine Nummer, sondern kannst dich tatsächlich mit deinen Ideen einbringen, an sinnvollen Projekten arbeiten und Dinge weiterentwickeln. Damit die Work-Life-Balance stimmt, ist unser Standort in Wallisellen bei Zürich nicht nur perfekt mit den ÖV erreichbar, bei uns profitierst du auch von einem Jahresarbeitszeitmodell, zusätzlichem Vaterschaftsurlaub und der Möglichkeit auf unbezahlten Zusatzurlaub. Wir fördern ausserdem Sport-Abos und Weiterbildung.


Es werden nur Direktbewerbungen akzeptiert – keine Personalvermittlungen oder Headhunter.

Welcome to Kanadevia Inova, a global innovation leader in the waste infrastructure space, where we believe in creating a sustainable future through technology and innovation.
At Kanadevia Inova, we pride ourselves on being at the forefront of waste-to-X technology. We are not just waste managers
column2: we are creators of value from what communities discard. Your role at Kanadevia Inova directly contributes to turning something once considered useless - waste - into something invaluable: energy, heat, hydrogen, fertilizer, and beyond.

column1: The Advanced Digitalization, of the Technology and Digitalization department, is developing innovative digital products to support our customers maximizing the performance of their plants. In this role you will be supporting R&D projects, under the supervision of Data Scientists, on the following tasks:
Support the specification of technical requirements, technical design of ML based products.
Conduct data exploration studies to develop concepts and validate ideas and hypotheses.
Contribute to the development of machine learning models.
Develop and maintain data labelling and annotation processes.
Develop and maintain product performance monitoring reports, focusing on machine learning performance metrics.
Contribute to the monitoring and maintenance of Azure cloud resources (e.g. Azure ML Studio).
Currently enrolled or completed BSc or MSc degree in a STEM degree (e.g. Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Mechanical or Electronic Engineering)
Exposure to python from studies, internships, or any other practical experience
Good command of English both written and verbal
Self-motivation and disciplined work ethics with a strong interest in self-learning
Responsible challenge with diversified field of activity
Team-oriented working atmosphere in an international Company
Personal development opportunities through own Inova Academy
Opportunity to gain an insight into various technical disciplines
Attractive working place (central, good transport links)
For HR agencies: Please note that we do not accept applications coming from agencies. Thank you.

column2:
we are creators of value from what communities discard. Your role at Kanadevia Inova directly contributes to turning something once considered useless - waste - into something invaluable: energy, heat, hydrogen, fertilizer, and beyond.

column3:
D projects, under the supervision of Data Scientists, on the following tasks:

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.
For our Web- & eCommerce Team we are looking for an additional member, who can be a full-time intern as well as staying with us longer term as a part-time working student.
As we have multiple different projects, we are able to offer interesting topics for students who are looking to gain some experience in fields such as
column2: data science and data engineering, business analysis, and other technical fields in order to create business applications and automate processes.

column1: Functional and semantic similarity modelling for chemical products
Exposing training materials with interactive chatbots
Website parsing with AI avoiding hallucinations and information loss
Visibility to IT management if that is perceived motivating
Well defined projects in case school requires formal documentations for credit(s)
database technologies and a query language
English language is needed, German/Spanish knowledge is advantage
For insights into what our colleagues say about working at Sika, please click here.
We look forward to your direct online application.

Company Description

Sika is a specialty chemicals company with a globally leading position in the development and production of systems and products for bonding, sealing, damping, reinforcing, and protection in the building sector and industry. Sika has subsidiaries in 103 countries around the world, produces in over 400 factories, and develops innovative technologies for customers worldwide. In doing so, it plays a crucial role in enabling the transformation of the construction and transportation industries toward greater environmental compatibility. In 2024, Sika’s around 33,000 employees generated annual sales of CHF 11.76 billion.

Job Description

For our Web- &
column2:
eCommerce Team we are looking for an additional member, who can be a full-time intern as well as staying with us longer term as a part-time working student.

As we have multiple different projects, we are able to offer interesting topics for students who are looking to gain some experience in fields such as
column3:
data science and data engineering, business analysis, and other technical fields in order to create business applications and automate processes.

Example Assignments

  • Functional and semantic similarity modelling for chemical products
  • Recommendation/ranking algorithms for eCommerce platform
  • Exposing training materials with interactive chatbots
  • Website parsing with AI avoiding hallucinations and information loss

What We Offer

  • Dynamic and fun team
  • Multicultural environment
  • Working with senior tech leads
  • Visibility to IT management if that is perceived motivating
  • Well defined projects in case school requires formal documentations for credit(s)

Qualifications

Basic understanding of:

  • at least one programming/scripting language
  • database technologies and a query language
  • data engineering and science basics

Soft Skills

  • Willingness to learn
  • Enjoyment of problem solving
  • English language is needed, German/Spanish knowledge is advantage

Additional Information

For insights into what our colleagues say about working at Sika, please click here.

We look forward to your direct online application.

Work with AI agentic frameworks and machine learning models.
Utilize cloud computing platforms, including Azure DevOps, for scalable data solutions.
Implement data visualization techniques to identify patterns and insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to refine AI and data science strategies.
Strong IT foundation with expertise in Data Engineering and Machine Learning.
Proficiency in Python, R, and statistical modeling techniques.
Experience with RAG, LLMs, and AI-driven frameworks.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure DevOps) and big data technologies.
Skilled in data visualization and pattern recognition.
This is a fantastic opportunity to work on AI-powered projects with a leading consultancy. If you're a Data Engineer looking for your next challenge, apply today!

Data Scientist

6-Month Contract

Location: Zurich (Hybrid)

Market Rate

Join a global technology consultancy that helps organizations solve complex challenges through cutting-edge software development, AI, and cloud solutions. We are seeking experienced Data Scientists to contribute to an AI-driven initiative, leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) frameworks.

Responsibilities:


  • Develop and optimize data pipelines to support AI-driven solutions.


  • Work with AI agentic frameworks and machine learning models.


  • Utilize cloud computing platforms, including Azure DevOps, for scalable data solutions.


  • Implement data visualization techniques to identify patterns and insights.


  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to refine AI and data science strategies.


About You:


  • Strong IT foundation with expertise in Data Engineering and Machine Learning.


  • Proficiency in Python, R, and statistical modeling techniques.


  • Experience with RAG, LLMs, and AI-driven frameworks.


  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (Azure DevOps) and big data technologies.


  • Skilled in data visualization and pattern recognition.


Apply Now

This is a fantastic opportunity to work on AI-powered projects with a leading consultancy. If you're a Data Engineer looking for your next challenge, apply today!

4184922135,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/head-of-data-science-modeling-r-d-f-m-d-80-100%25-at-lonza-4184922135?position=1&pageNum=5&refId=psuNwxc6N1Cm2bZLet6XVQ%3D%3D&trackingId=cT8nSOB9LMsXdHdAFmmTnA%3D%3D,Head of Data Science & Modeling R&D (f/m/d) 80-100%,Lonza,"Basel, Basel, Switzerland","Switzerland, Basel

Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across five continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.

The role's purpose and scope are to Lead the SM data science and modeling strategy/ roadmap across the business platform to generate unique insights from data and develop new differentiated offerings using modeling tools. The incumbent will lead a team of expert data scientists/engineers, programmers and modeling experts (AI, mechanistic, statistical) deployed across multiple projects to enable the deployment of industry-leading data science and modeling capabilities.
An agile career and dynamic working culture in a growing environment.
Compensation programs that recognize high performance.
Act as strategic lead for data science and modeling across the organization (R&D, MSAT, dev services, etc) and partner with relevant leads in other Business platforms.
Effectively manage resources and projects in line with prioritized business needs.
Support all business areas (chemistry, bio enhancement, oral drug product, drug delivery), functions (R&D, operations, quality, etc) and sites.
Ensure advanced data science and modeling is a key enabler across our innovation pipeline and operations.
Partner with IT Hub and spoke with contacts to ensure aligned strategy and investment.
Ensure effective deployment of data ops/flows and visualization and modeling tools in operations, and services, through simplified workbenches, workflows, and apps as well as training.
Accelerate the adoption of AI/ML as well as statistical and mechanistic modeling in the organization including through partnerships / external collaborations.
Work closely with other SMEs (IT, Automation, analytical, etc) to ensure alignment of project and priorities.
PhD in Science, an equivalent professional qualification or occupational experience in Chemical engineering, statistics, chem-informatics/chemometrics .
Minimum of 10 years of experience leading/managing projects, including technology projects, in a pharmaceutical /CDMO setting .
Solid experience delivering strong value (new offerings, acceleration, etc) through the development and deployment of modeling tools in a pharmaceutical /CDMO environment.
Demonstrated ability to operate in a complex matrix environment.
Proven track record /scientific expertise in the development and deployment of complex modeling tools, programming, electronic lab notebooks, apps,etc
Established collaboration network and external recognition as SME in the field
Ability to operate at multiple levels from strategic planning to site operational deployment in line with broader R&D and BU objectives .
Support own and matrix team resource planning, project management activities and prioritization decisions.
Strong communication skills and capacity to translate technical information into business insights for decision-making process.

Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.

People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Lonza is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a qualified individual with disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
